meanings.definition: A person who occupies land or property rented from a landlord.
meanings.sent1: The tenant paid rent to the landlord every month.
meanings.sent2: The new tenant moved into the apartment last week.
meanings.sent3: The tenant accidentally locked themselves out of the house.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a loyal tenant of the sun's warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The tenant's presence in the building was as constant as the ticking of a clock.

meanings.sent1: She decided to tenant the house near the park.
meanings.sent2: They will tenant the office space for the next year.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels tend to tenant the trees in our backyard.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts would tenant his mind, refusing to leave.
meanings.sent5: The music would tenant the room, filling it with joy and rhythm.
